On Tue, 21 Sep 2004 13:01:48 -0400, J. B. Rainsberger
<jbrains@...> wrote:
> 
> Can you change your design so that you can give the components in
> question the class loaders you want them to use? Then your tests
> instantiate different class loaders and hands them in. I don't know
> class loading that well, so could it work?

Unfortunately not - in general, the components don't control their
loading. Timothy is correct, this is a difficult problem, and the best
way may in fact be to isolate the classes appropriately if possible.
One of the things I was hoping to check was packaging errors, where a
class that the client needs is only loaded from the client jars even
though the server jars have them as well. I had hoped this was a
common problem that others had solved (and might be in your book), but
apparently not.
